intro: Bossiaea dentata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid conditions, making it a hardy species. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance.
